attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tonnage
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage. If you do, Piloswine does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Light Piloswine

abilities.name: Fluffy Wool
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Light Piloswine is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by your opponent's attack (even if it's Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, the attacking Pokémon is now Asleep. This power stops working if Light Piloswine is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when your opponent attacks.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: If there is a Stadium card in play, you may discard it.

data.flavorText: Its legs are short, but its hooves are wide and flat, allowing it to easily walk over snow.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 90 damage from it.

data.flavorText: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quintuple Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: With its excellent sense of smell, it's even able to find mushrooms that are buried under frozen ground.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from Piloswine. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: High-Speed Charge
attacks.text: Piloswine does 30 damage to itself. Piloswine can't use this attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack. (Benching or evolving the Defending Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon; if tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Rouse
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Piloswine. Then, remove 4 damage counters from Piloswine.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Charge Dash
attacks.text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Piloswine does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.

attacks.name: Continuous Charge
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads. Put a damage counter on Piloswine for each heads.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gathering Footsteps
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Colorless in the Retreat Cost of your Swinub, Piloswine, and Mamoswine.

data.flavorText: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.

data.name: Piloswine
data.flavorText: Covered by a shaggy coat, it is resistant to the cold. Its tusks of ice thicken when it snows.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Covered by a shaggy coat, it is resistant to the cold. Its tusks of ice thicken when it snows.
